info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 9:28PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. A sharp snowfall gradient is expected across the Chicago metro and Illinois River Valley, with the highest amounts farther south. The highest snowfall rates will be Tuesday night into Wednesday afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Illinois. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes on Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A sharp snowfall gradient is expected across the Chicago metro and Illinois River Valley, with snowfall amounts varying by several inches over distances of 10 to 20 miles, or less than one county.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
